channel.title: José Luis Rodríguez Fragoso
channel.description: Technology student from México → Love coding, chemistry, biology & computers.

item.title: WhatsPwn 2.0
item.description:
There is a new version of the linux tool WhatsPwn which features new payload options like meterpreter injection or the ability to create hidden or visible payloads and inject them into any android device. It is still in beta stage so there may be some bugs and some features may not work properly but updates are constantly rolling, so expect updates very soon.

This is brief tutorial on how to use this tool, which just makes the process of extracting sensitive data like WhatsApp databases and fotos, and injecting backdoor payloads a lot easier.

INSTALLATION

The first thing you need to do is clone the repository

git clone https://github.com/jlrodriguezf/WhatsPwn.git

Once you have done that we can proceed.

CONFIGURATION

There are two files that you might want to edit first, the config file and the server file
